input:
Definition: In this task, we ask you convert a data table of restaurant descriptions into fluent natural-sounding English sentences. The input is a string of key-value pairs; the output should be a natural and grammatical English sentence containing all the information from the input.
Positive example 1-
input: name[Aromi], eatType[restaurant], food[English], area[city centre]
output: Aromi is an English restaurant in the city centre.
Positive example 2-
input: name[The Rice Boat], food[Indian], priceRange[cheap], customer rating[5 out of 5], area[city centre], familyFriendly[yes], near[Express by Holiday Inn]
output: The Rice Boat is a cheap Indian restaurant in the center of the city near Express by Holiday Inn. It is family friendly and has the highest customer rating.
Now complete the following example-
input: name[The Waterman], food[Fast food], familyFriendly[yes], near[Crowne Plaza Hotel]
output:
output: The Waterman is a family friendly fast food establishment situated close to the Crown Plaza Hotel.
